reviews.text: ROOM: We stayed in the Cypress Room, which was large and clean, but didn't have the sort of "charm" I'd hoped for. It felt more like staying in someone's guest room than staying at B&B. The bed was really comfy and the tub was great for a soak.
reviews.title: Classy and comfortable

reviews.text: Talk about a quiet place to stay! We stayed in the New Braunfels Cottage and had a blast. Next time we come we will definately bring food and plan to cook there vs. going out every night. Has all the emenities you will need including cookware and a gas grille. Very spacious for my family of 4. Breakfast muffins were excellent however they were gone within the first 5 minutes of our arrival. Only thing is that you are not served a breakfast, but we knew that going in so I'm not going to complain. I like how I was provided with milk and orange juice in the fridge and having small kids that was real convenient. The thing I usually critique most about places I stay is the A/C system. I'm miserable at night if I'm hot and the A/C here worked great. Would recommend and will stay here again!
reviews.title: Great Place, Highly Recommend!

reviews.text: What a wonderful place! Spacious, clean and convenient to San Antonio. The accommodations were wonderful. If I ever get back to the San Antonio area, I will stay at the Comal Inn.

reviews.text: I wish I could rate this Inn more than five!!!! I stayed there with some friends during the Final Four weekend in San Antonio. We found the Inn to be convenient to San Antonio and close to a wide variety of excellent restaurants. The rooms were spacious, clean, and had everything we could ask for.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Comal Inn for one night on a spontaneous road trip through the hill country. We had the "Mountain Laurel Room." Pluses: large room, clean, with lots of windows, comfortable bed, big tub, lots of towels, good parking, good price. WORD TO THE WISE: Trains pass through town at night and you can hear them, so if you're not used to train noise, take some earplugs. We did not see anyone else the whole time we were there, except one couple getting in their car in the parking lot. So it was like we had the place to ourselves. The Comal Inn is not so much a destination in itself (like some others that have spas, grounds, activities, etc), but it's a good, clean, safe place to stay.
reviews.title: Good value, very pleased

reviews.text: It is a historic structure and some of the original fachwerk construction has been exposed. Although the cottage is over 100 years old, it has all the modern amenities. The Inn has several newer rooms available that looked very nice.
reviews.title: The Comal Inn was PERFECT for us!

reviews.text: The property was immaculately kept and well situated on a quiet residential street that is just blocks from the New Braunfels historic district as well as Schlitterbahn.
reviews.title: Great for Large Families
Great little cottage!
reviews.text: This is not the place for a gourmet communal breakfast experience and that was fine with us. The first morning's breakfast is already in your room when you arrive. It consists of fresh baked strawberry pecan bread, fruit, coffee, OJ, and milk. It was delicious but after that you're on your own. Our cottage had a complete kitchen but we preferred to sample the local fare at different restaurants.

reviews.title: Great little B&B!
reviews.text: The Comal Inn is a great little Bed & Breakfast in the heart of New Braunfels, just steps from the Comal River and Schlitterbahn. We stayed in one of the one bedroom rooms and loved the atmosphere and the decor. It is a very peaceful, private setting that we really enjoyed! The room was up-to-date and modern in its furnishings with all the amenities that you need, much better than staying in one of the New Braunfels hotels, for pretty much the same price! The bathroom was beautifully appointed and the room was just nice to come back to after a long day at Schlitterbahn! The private porch with tables, chairs and benches is a nice touch, and the friendly, accomodating owners made us feel at home in their inn. I have trouble seeing 4 people situated comfortably in this room as the website suggests, but overall give this B&B my highest recommendation!
